body_html:
For your needs, a workaround would be to explicitly set the shape using out.set_shape([None, 10, 5, 5]) so code downstream knows (from out.shape or out.get_shape()) what you wanted them to know.

I'll dig in a bit more about a more principled fix. Let me know if the workaround is sufficient for you for now.

body:
For your needs, a workaround would be to explicitly set the shape using `out.set_shape([None, 10, 5, 5])` so code downstream knows (from `out.shape` or `out.get_shape()`) what you wanted them to know.

I'll dig in a bit more about a more principled fix. Let me know if the workaround is sufficient for you for now.
